entry.title: BIP process
entry.summary: In an email exchange on October 19, 2014, a member of a Bitcoin mailing list expressed their surprise at the low traffic on the list given the importance of Bitcoin. The member stated that they would vote against splitting up the list as it would only serve to dilute the peer review quality found in the current single list setup. Another member replied, agreeing with the sentiment and stressing the importance of keeping discussions centralized for effective peer review. The exchange highlights the value placed on open communication and collaboration within the Bitcoin community.
